p: A stirred solution of epoxide ( 28– 38, 10 mmol) in dry benzene (6 ml) was treated with an excess of isopropylamine or tert-butylamine (50 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred for 12 h at 90 °C, and then evaporated. The crude was dissolved in a mixture of MeOH/EtOH 3:7 (20 ml) and treated with 1.2 equivalent of the proper organic acid (oxalic, malic or fumaric acids) to give the corresponding amino alcohol ( 1– 13) as a white solid salt.
